data.title: Came recommended, but.....
data.text:
My dear friend recommended George's to us, as one of the best places in town to grab a cheeseburger, so my daughter and I ventured over there to see for ourselves.

We both ordered a cheeseburger which came with fries. I was so disappointed! The fries on both our plates were all over the place. I couldn't find our cheeseburger. Thankfully, they bring an extra plate with your food order, because I had to go digging. 

The cheeseburger is served open faced and needless to say, fries were stuck to it like glue.

The fries were cold. I dont know if they were old or if it really took that long for me to get them off the one plate and onto another, but neither of us could eat them.

The burger was no better than anything I make at home. 

Our sever had a smile on her face WHEN she bothered to come to the table. When being the key word. I waited for quite some time for her to bring us a check. After quite the wait and no check in sight, I went to the counter hoping she'd either see us waiting to pay, or the cashier would get it for me. Sigh......we encountered another longer than necessary wait at the counter.

We won't be returning. Cold fries, cheap kraft singles for the cheese, poor service, and a customer that had to practically resort to begging in order to get the check.....I can't think of one reason to go out of my way again for this, when there are so many other burger joints to choose from along the way.

data.title: Dependable- Friendly
data.text: My go to place for lunch- always good!  My favorite is the Greek salad n they have the best ice tea.  In the cooler months their vegetable beef soup is really good . If u like pie treat yourself to a piece 😀

data.title: Good Diner Food
data.text:
A good old diner.  Their French fries were great and the portions were big.  I had a plate of Greek spaghetti.  It actually tasted a lot like Cincinnati chili and was pretty good, but I thought it was a bit overpriced in relation to the other dishes.  The waitress couldn't answer my questions about the dish but I ordered it anyway and it was good.
My bro-in-law had a double chili cheeseburger and it was huge and smothered in chili.  
We will certainly be going back again.

data.title: Best burger I have ever had!!!
data.text: This place, hands down, has the best burger ever!  It literally falls apart in your mouth. Yum! My family and I tried this for the first time while visiting UAFS. We will be heading back for another burger! Also, you get a ton of fries, which are good. The pie is great too! You can't go wrong with food/burger here!!

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: This place is known for it's burgers and generous servings of french fries.  I'm sure other dishes are good as well, but most folks had burgers on the night we visited.  They are also known for their pies.

data.title: You Must Get There Before Noontime!
data.text: While visiting a co-worker at UA-Fort Smith, he suggested George's for lunch.  We got there at 11:30 and the place was packed for a Monday!  Great burgers with huge portions of homemade fries.  Also recommend the wraps - very good!

data.title: Home style food!
data.text: Fries, fries and more fries!  They are generous with the fries and they are good.  The burgers are good too.  Not great if you are on a diet and are tempted.  But not to be missed if you visit Ft. Smith.

data.title: Good salmon burger and generous fries
data.text: My wife and I met some friends from our college days at George's during a business trip to Fort Smith this past February.  I had the salmon burger and fries.  My wife had a Greek salad.  They give you a generous portion of hand cut fries.  My lunch was very good.  It was an enjoyable visit with our friends.  George's is a good place for lunch.

data.title: Needs Improvement in Cleanliness
data.text: We eat here for lunch sometime and the food is usually good but the owner definitely doesn't take any pride in how it's run. The people he has cleaning tables and wrapping silverware need some supervision. They wipe the chairs or booth seating with a wet cloth THEN wipe the table with the same cloth. I have sat close to the counter and watch them touching the rims of the glasses, handling the silverware with their hands while wrapping. Dining there in the early evening....the mess on the floor has not been cleaned up since the lunch hour....it is just nasty!!  By the way...they do not serve breakfast as someone said they ate there recently for breakfast.

data.title: Great little Diner.
data.text: Breakfast anytime. Very good for a cook to order place. Gets pretty crowded after school hours. Liked that they are open whenever.

data.title: Best of Fort Smith
data.text:
Georges burgers and fries are hard to beat! My family enjoys dining here style at once a month.  Always the friendliest wait staff!  Local family owned and has the best desserts... My favorite is the
Honeybun cake.

data.title: Old diner style with large portions and great food!
data.text: Spending the weekend in Fort Smith, I looked up the best burger and found George's.  Definitely worth the trip!  Huge plate of fries came with the burger, both were delicious.  My waitress was on top of everything.  I went through 4 drink refills and she made sure they were filled before I emptied them.  Tried one of their homemade cookies on the way out and it was delicious.  If you're in Fort Smith, go there!

data.title: If You Can See Your Sandwich, You Don't Have Enough Fries
data.text:
A tradition in Fort Smith, George's offers great food at great prices.

Their hamburgers are freshly made and are literally covered by a mound of french fries (which are also fresh). That's why they give you two plates!

Never have tried anything but a hamburger. I think you wouldn't be sorry trying anything on their menu.

data.title: Gyros are great!
data.text: This is a very popular lunch spot. The food was superb. I had the Gyro and fries. It was very busy at lunch time but the service was quick and friendlky.

data.title: Old style place and menu
data.text:
I wanted to enjoy George’s and as a group we can’t write a strong review.
The food was not special, the sandwiches were short on protein, and less tasty then expected.

data.title: Always great food
data.text: Always a pleasant experience, Great food, TONS of Fresh fries with burgers, Pie is delicious. Great Variety

data.title: Delicious French Fries
data.text:
Georges is a great home-town restaurant. Everyone is friendly. The atmosphere is family friendly and casual.

I love their burgers (not too huge or overwhelming) and the HUGE plate of delicious French fries. Sandwiches are also good. Just make sure you order the fries.

data.title: Best Burger and fries!
data.text: A locally owned family place that has been around for years. Great Greek salads, cheeseburgers and huge servings of real hand cut fries. Trust me one order is enough for 2. Maybe 3!

data.title: Good food and good staff.
data.text: Saw that people had said this was the Best Burgers in town. My parents agreed. I don't eat burgers, but I got a quesadilla and it was delicious. The staff was friendly too. The location isn't in the greatest part of town, but it stays busy enough for the riff raff to stay away. Large plates of food and all of it good and at good prices. I would recommend.

data.title: The Community Standard for a neighborhood restaurant.
data.text: A very busy restaurant serving lunch and dinner. Good Burgers,salads,sandwiches and plate lunches,also serving beer and wine. A community standard for good food  and  service in a friendly atmosphere.
